summary: The document is a declassified, 'SECRET' communication related to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It details the arrival of a Cuban asset, known as AMLASH/1, in Madrid in December 1979. The asset refused interviews with EOLA representatives, and a meeting was scheduled to discuss future plans. The document urgently requests contact instructions and details for a station contact in Madrid, indicating the operation's sensitive and time-sensitive nature.
key_findings: The document is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It details a covert operation involving a Cuban asset (AMLASH/1) in Madrid.
The asset refused interviews with EOLA representatives, indicating a possible sensitive or classified nature of their mission or information.
A meeting was tentatively scheduled to debrief the asset and determine future plans, highlighting ongoing intelligence operations.
The urgency in the request for contact information suggests the operation was time-sensitive.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
